intents.tags: normal, eye, able, objects, closer, cm
patterns: Why is a normal eye not able to see clearly the objects placed closer than 25 cm?
responses: The maximum accommodation of a normal eye is reached when the object is at a distance of 25 cm from the eye. The focal length of the eye lens cannot be decreased below this minimum limit. Thus an object placed closer than 25cm [or very close to eye] cannot be seen clearly by a normal eye.

intents.tags: image, distance, eye, distance, object, eye
patterns: What happens to the image distance in the eye when we increase the distance of an object from the eye?
responses:
The distance eye lens and retina is the image distance inside the eye. The image distance is fixed.
It cannot be changed at all.
Therefore
when we increase the distance of an object from the eye
there is no change in the image distance inside the eye.

patterns: Why do stars twinkle?
responses: The twinkling of a star is due to atmospheric refraction of starlight. The atmospheric refraction occurs in a medium of gradually changing refractive index. Since the atmosphere bends starlight towards the normal
the apparent position of the star is slightly different from its actual position. This apparent position of the star is not stationary
but keeps on changing slightly
as the physical conditions of the earths atmosphere are not stationary since the stars are very distant
they approximate point - sized sources of light. As the path of rays of light coming from the star goes on varying slightly
the' apparent position of the star fluctuates and the amount. Of starlight entering the eye flickers some other time
fainter
which ic the tirinkling offert

patterns: Explain why the planets do not twinkle.
responses: The planets are much closer to the earth and are thus seen as extended sources. If we consider a plant as a collection of a large number of point sized sources of light
the total variation in the amount of light entering our eye from all the individual point-sized sources will average out to zero
thereby nullifying the twinkling effect.

patterns: Why does the Sun appear reddish early in the morning?
responses:
Light from the Sun near the horizon passes through thicker layers of air and larger distance in the earth's atmosphere before reaching our eyes.
However
light from the Sun overhead would travel relatively shorter distance. At noon
the Sun appears white as only a little of the blue and violet colours are scattered. Near the horizon

most of the blue light and shorter wavelengths are
scattered away by the particles.
Therefore
the light that reaches our eyes is of longer wavelengths. This gives rise to the reddish appearance of the Sun.

patterns: Why does the sky appear dark instead of blue to an astronaut?
responses: When sunlight passes through the atmosphere
the fine particles in air scatter the blue colour (shorter wavelength more strongly than red. The scattered blue light enters our eyes. If the earth had no atmosphere
there would not have been any scattering. Then the sky would have looked dark. The sky appears dark to astronaut flying at very high attitude
as scattering is not prominent at such heights.

patterns: Which causes presbyopia? Name the lens to correct this defect.
responses:
This causes due to the gradual weakening of the ciliary muscles and diminishing flexibility of the eye lens.
A common type of bi-focal lense is necessary to correct this defect.

patterns: Who discovered spectrum of sunlight?
responses: Isaac Newton.

patterns: What is the reason for Advance sunrise and delayed sunset?
responses: The sun is visible to us about 2 minutes before the actual sunrise
and about 2 minutes after the actual sunset because of atmospheric refraction.

patterns: At noon

the sun appears white.
Give reason.
responses: Because at noon
the sun appears white as only a little of the blue and violet colours are scattered.

patterns: What does an electric circuit mean?

The SI unit of electric current is ampere (A).
When I coulomb of electric charge flows through any cross.
Section of a conductor in I second

the electric current flowing through it is said to be 1 ampere.

patterns: On what factors does the resistance of a conductor depend?

The resistance of the conductor depends

intents.tags: current, thick, wire, thin, wire, same, material, same, source
patterns: Will current flow more easily through a thick wire or a thin wire of the same material

when connected to the same source?
Why?
responses: Resistance

Ra_. The resistance of a conductor is inversely proportional to its area of cross-section. A thick wire has a greater area of cross-section whereas a thin wire has a smaller area of cross-section.
Thus
thick wire has less resistance and a thin wire has more resistance therefore current will flow more easily through a thick wire.

patterns: Why does the cord of an electric heater not glow while the heating element does?

as current flows these become hot arid glows but in case of electric heater this will not happen.

P = VI.

Two magnetic fields lines of force never intersect each other.
If the lines intersect

patterns: What is the principle of an electric motor?
responses: A current-carrying conductor when placed in a magnetic field experiences a force. This is the principle of an electric motor.

patterns: What is the role of the split ring in an electric motor?
responses: The split ring reverse the direction of current in the armature coil after every half rotation i.e
it acts as a commutator. The reversal of current reverses
the direction of the forces acting on the two arms of the armature after every half rotation. This allows the armature coil to rotate continuously in the same direction.

patterns: Explain different ways to induce current in a coil.
responses: We can induce current in a coil either by moving it in a magnetic field or by changing the magnetic around it. It is convenient in most situations to move the coil in a magnetic field.

patterns: State the principle of an electric generator.
responses: Based on the phenomenon of electromagnetic induction

electric generator are prepared.
In an electric generator
Mechanical energy is used to rotate a conductor in a magnetic field to produce electricity. This is the principle of an electric generator.

intents.tags: function, earth, wire, necessary, metallic, appliances

electric press
toaster
table fan
refrigerator

etc. The metallic body is connected to the earth wire which provides a low-resistance conducting path for the current. Thus earth wire ensures that any leakage of current to the metallic body of the appliance keeps its potential to that of the earth and the user may not get a severe electric shock.

alternate sources of energy were explored.

responses: No source of energy be pollution free. Because fossil fuels cause air pollution. Nuclear energy causes more hazards for environment. In some cases

responses: Air pollution is caused by burning of coal or petroleum products. The oxides of carbon

patterns: What is the role of decomposers in the ecosystem?
responses: Microorganisms
comprising bacteria and Fungi

break-down the dead remains and waste products of organisms. These microorganisms are the decomposers as they breakdown the complex organic substances into simple inorganic substances that go into the soil and are used up once more by the plants.

patterns: Why are some substances biodegradable and some non-biodegradable?
responses: Substances that are broken down by biological processes are said to be biodegradable. Eg: paper and peel of a fruit. But plastic leather etc. are not broken down. These are called Non-biodegradable.

patterns: What will happen if we kill all the organisms in one trophic level?
responses: If we kill all the organisms in one trophic level

the population size of organisms in lower level increases uncontrollably and the number of organisms in higher trophic level decreases due to non-availability of food. This results in an imbalance in ecosystem.

patterns: What are the problems caused by the non-biodegradable wastes that we generate?

patterns: What changes can you make in your habits to become more environment friendly?

patterns: What would be the advantages of exploiting resources with short-term aims?

intents.tags: equitable, distribution, resources, forces, equitable, distribution, resources

Nature shows no partiality.
